citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The attending veterinarian did not visit the facility in the last year (2024). The program of veterinary care states that
regularly scheduled visits by the veterinarian will be completed annually, however, a veterinary visit has not occurred
since July 31, 2023.
It's important to follow the program of veterinary care and have regularly scheduled visits by the veterinarian to ensure
that the animals are receiving proper medical care, and that the veterinarian is familiar with the animals and facility in
order to provide appropriate veterinary guidance.
The applicant must follow their program of veterinary care including regularly scheduled veterinary visits to the premises.

Twelve of the water bottles for the rabbits have a build-up of algae on the sides of the containers.
An accumulation of algae in water bottles can expose the rabbits to potential health risks and deter the animals from
drinking.
The applicant must ensure that all watering receptacles are sanitized when dirty, and at least once every 2 weeks.
This is the 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “B” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by August 25, 2025 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires on July 27, 2025.
n

narrative:
2.40(a)(1) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
The attending veterinarian did not visit the facility in the last year (2024). The program of veterinary care states that 
regularly scheduled visits by the veterinarian will be completed annually, however, a veterinary visit has not occurred 
since July 31, 2023.  
It's important to follow the program of veterinary care and have regularly scheduled visits by the veterinarian to ensure 
that the animals are receiving proper medical care, and that the veterinarian is familiar with the animals and facility in 
order to provide appropriate veterinary guidance.  
The applicant must follow their program of veterinary care including regularly scheduled veterinary visits to the premises. 
3.55 
   
Watering. 
Twelve of the water bottles for the rabbits have a build-up of algae on the sides of the containers.  
An accumulation of algae in water bottles can expose the rabbits to potential health risks and deter the animals from 
drinking.  
The applicant must ensure that all watering receptacles are sanitized when dirty, and at least once every 2 weeks. 
 
This is the 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “B” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by August 25, 2025 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee 
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires on July 27, 2025. 
 
 n
